brief_summary.textblock:
We hypothesised that in women with stress urinary incontinence, the severity of leakage on a
      24 hour pad test was affected by activity.

clinical_study.brief_title: Does Patient Activity Level Affect 24-Hour Pad Test Results in Stress-Incontinent Women
clinical_study.condition: 24-hour Pad Test Weight Gain With and Without Activity

detailed_description.textblock:
We asked women to perform two separate pad tests, one with normal activity, and another with
      decreased activity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Stress urinary incontinence

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  language other than english

clinical_study.official_title: Does Patient Activity Level Affect 24-Hour Pad Test Results in Stress-Incontinent Women?

oversight_info.authority: Australia: Department of Health and Ageing Therapeutic Goods Administration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
